intro: Chalcas alata, commonly known as the winged chalcas, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. The plant is native to certain regions of Southeast Asia and thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
